revised_title: Development of the Sympathetic Nervous System in Mammals
tldr: The author discusses the development of the sympathetic nervous system in mammals, focusing on the structure and functions of the ganglia. They describe the various regions of the sympathetic chain, the connections between the ganglia and spinal nerves, and the different stages of development in various species. The author also reviews the existing literature on the topic and presents their own observations on the origin and formation of the sympathetic nervous system.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
